alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Hocking; Pickaway; Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 10:08PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN FAIRFIELD, HOCKING, SOUTHEASTERN PICKAWAY AND NORTHEASTERN ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 1100 PM EDT... At 1008 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 10 miles east of Circleville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Lancaster, Logan, Bremen, Kingston, Hocking Hills State Park, Hide-A-Way Hills, Royalton, Amanda, Stoutsville, Laurelville, Sugar Grove, Adelphi, Rushville, Tarlton, West Rushville, Fairfield County Airport, South Bloomingville, Clearport and North Berne. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM EDT for southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
